title: Inside Line: How Steve Borthwick and the staggering detail of England's lineout strategy inspired epic win over New Zealand
text:
New Zealand have a reputation for using the perceived strength of an opponent against them. Their powerful, punchy display against the British and Irish Lions in Auckland two summers ago was an archetypal example of this.

During a stirring, 19-7 victory over the All Blacks in Saturday’s Rugby World Cup semi-final, England did something similar. Steve Hansen had bolstered his pack with Scott Barrett, the man who helped derail Eddie Jones’ team last November.

The reigning champions clearly aimed to disrupt England’s lineout and depriving them of a study platform. They reckoned against the staggeringly detailed strategy of Steve Borthwick and the confident lineout calling of Maro Itoje, who produced...
